data.title: Unique Menu
data.text: When you're ready for something completely different, this is the place. They have a very unique menu with large portions. Liquor is served. Located directly across the street from the Rialto Square Theatre in downtown Joliet just past the fountain and near the parking garage. Give it a try.

data.title: Pleasantly surprised... yummy!!  Can't wait to try other items on the menu!
data.text: Couldn't agree more with Lucas A's review.  Surprisingly delicious.  Wasn't sure what to expect.  Server seemed as excited for the menu as I was to try it.  Had the chicken salad Arepa and tried the chicken Empanadas.  Can't wait to go back to try more menu items.  Seemed very fresh, and it was very quick to the table.

data.title: Surprisingly delicious!
data.text: I was not sure what to expect when I visited, as I have never tried Venezuelan food before, but it was impressively tasty! Simple ingredients and very fresh food.

data.title: Tasty South American Twist
data.text:
Stopped by for a late lunch. I didn't know their hours, they close at 2pm Mon. -Wed. and it was right at 2. The guy at the counter said they could do a carryout order for me, I said yes as I have been wanting to try this place since it opened. I ordered the shredded beef Empanada appetizer (3 pieces for $5) and the Pabellon Bowl with shredded beef ($7.95).

The empanadas were tasty.They are made with white corn and well filled. They are served with a green dipping sauce that tasted good. Not too spicy, it was flavorful.

Besides the shreeded beef, the Pabellon bowl had white rice, 3 fried plantain slices, black beans, lettuce, tomatoes, onion, mozzarella, and parmesan cheese. I had never had any kind of plantain before and have to say I liked the fried ones they served. Outside of the plantains, I know it sounds like a bowl you could get at other places but it was very good. There were subtle differences in flavors from the black beans and the shredded beef, making it a different experience from the chain fast food bowl places. A good kind of different. The portion was a large amount for the price, very filling also.

It is not a large menu, but that's good. If you do enough things well, you don't need hundreds of items. They have 3 appetizers listed besides the empanadas, a soup of the day, 6 other House Favorite bowls, a salad bowl, 2 main dishes for a little more that include soup and arepa, 5 sides, 9 types of arepas, and Quesillo (Venezuelan Flan).

I brought my food home and shared some of it and my wife and daughter also liked it. I definitly want to go back again. It's closer to home than any of the chain "bowl" places and just as good if not better. If you are in the area, its worth trying out. Almost across the street from the Rialto Theater in Joliet, another option to have a bite to eat before a show there.

The menu I brought home lists hours of Mon.-Wed. 10 am to 2 pm, Thu.-Fri. 10am to 6pm, Sat.-Sun.-Special Events.
